title: Truck Driver’s 110-Year Prison Term Is Cut to 10 Years
sub_head: The 110-year sentence imposed on Rogel Aguilera-Mederos for a deadly 2019 highway crash in Colorado drew outrage earlier this month
body:
A truck driver who received a 110-year prison term for a Colorado highway crash that killed four people has had his sentence reduced sharply by the state’s governor.
Gov. Jared Polis on Thursday commuted Rogel Aguilera-Mederos’s sentence to 10 years. Mr. Aguilera-Mederos’s original sentence for the 2019 incident sparked an outcry and drew attention to the state’s mandatory sentencing minimums.
